p: After oral administration for 1 h, the test mice were placed in the rodent restrainer, a plastic tube with ventilation. One-third of the tail of the test mouse were immersed in water at 50 °C, and then the span of time in seconds was recorded as the tail of mouse was withdrawn from the hot water. When the span of time is more than 10 s, it is recommended to quickly remove the mouse’s tail from hot water to avoid injury to the mice. The longer span of time in the tail flick test reveals the better antinociceptive effect of the treatment [ 36, 37, 38].
